title.narrative: Première Urgence- Aide Médical Int. DPRK 2014-2016

description.narrative:
Den föreslagna insatsen ämnar till att skapa bättre åtkomst av kvalitetssäkrad hälsovård åt befolkning på landsbyggden i DPRK av PU-AMI i södra Hwanghae provinsen. Insatsen kommer att implementeras av PU-AMI, i samarbete med relevanta nationella, regionala och lokala samarbetsparter och syftar till att rehabilitera hälsokliniker på landsbyggden, införskaffa modern och hygienisk medicinsk utrustning samt att stärka kapaciteten hos de anställda på hälsoklinikerna.
Den rådande Nordkoreanska kontexten har resulterat i att ett fåtal organisationer och givare i landet är aktiva. Sida är den enda givaren till denna insats, men PU-AMI finansieras även av EU i en annan insats med fokus på matsäkerhet. Även denna insats implementeras i södra Hwanghae provinsen, och har därmed samma målgrupp som denna insats. Med fokus på samma målgrupp i samma geografiska områden i de två insatserna bedöms större möjligheter finnas för hållbara resultat. Sida bedömmer det rimligt som den enda givare till denna insats, till grund av ovannämnda Nordkoreanska kontexten.

The proposed initiative aims to create better access to quality-assured health care for the rural population in the DPRK by PU-AMI in southern Hwanghae Province. The initiative will be implemented by PU-AMI, in collaboration with relevant national, regional and local partners and aims to rehabilitate health clinics in rural areas, procure modern and hygienic medical equipment and to strengthen the capacity of employees at health clinics.
The prevailing North Korean context has resulted in a few organizations and donors in the country being active. Sida is the only donor to this initiative, but PU-AMI is also funded by the EU in another initiative focusing on food security. This initiative is also being implemented in southern Hwanghae Province, and thus has the same target group as this initiative. With a focus on the same target group in the same geographical areas in the two initiatives, it is judged that there are greater opportunities for sustainable results. Sida considers it reasonable as the only donor to this effort, due to the above-mentioned North Korean context.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: PUI’s overall objective of the project was to improve access to primary health care in rural areas in North Korea. This was done through the specific objective to improve the quality of health services provided to the patients of four clinics located South Hwanghae province’s rural areas, as well as improve household hygiene with running water in the houses. Prior to the project, the health infrastructure of the four clinics were rapidly deteriorating with no functioning safety and sanitary conditions. PUI addressed this by reconstructing the clinics and building them in compliance with hygiene standards, thus offering better working and care conditions for staff and patients. The design of the building was followed by guidelines by Handicap International, and the four clinics are better insulated and supplied with electricity and running water.
The project has to a large extent achieved their intended outcomes in accordance to the objectives, with minor deviations due to difficulty to assess the site before the project, as well as monitoring constraints during. PUI designed their construction plans in close coordination with the farms, MoPH and the health advisor of the PUI headquarters. However, some beneficiaries did not adhere to the agreed plans during the construction phase, and often reconsidered the organization of the rooms without sharing it with PUI. The project manager often noticed the changes during the field visits, when it was too late to do anything about it. Nevertheless, each clinic has included necessary rooms in line with a working clinic, for instance an OBGYN department, paediatric consultation room, minor surgery room, pharmacy and laboratory.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
